title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: outlines propose change MyBioconductorPackage. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("kevinrue/MyBioconductorPackage", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to MyBioconductorPackage
text: Please note MyBioconductorPackage project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: Thanks using MyBioconductorPackage! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. See also Bioconductor help website. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. Bioconductor-related question, please ask Bioconductor Support Website using appropriate package tag (website send automatic email package authors). people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with MyBioconductorPackage
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: The iSEEhex package
text: iSEE package (Rue-Albrecht et al. 2018) provides general flexible framework interactively exploring SummarizedExperiment objects. However, many cases, specialized panels required effective visualization specific data types. iSEEhex package implements panels summarising data points hexagonal bins, work directly iSEE application can smoothly interact panels. first load package: panels described document can deployed simply passing iSEE() function via initial= argument, shown following examples.

title: The iSEEhex package
text: Let us prepare example SingleCellExperiment object. , create iSEE app compares ReducedDimensionHexPlot panel – defined package – standard ReducedDimensionPlot defined iSEE package.
code: library(scRNAseq)  # Example data ---- sce <- ReprocessedAllenData(assays="tophat_counts") class(sce) ## [1] "SingleCellExperiment" ## attr(,"package") ## [1] "SingleCellExperiment" library(scater) sce <- logNormCounts(sce, exprs_values="tophat_counts")  sce <- runPCA(sce, ncomponents=4) sce <- runTSNE(sce) rowData(sce)$ave_count <- rowMeans(assay(sce, "tophat_counts")) rowData(sce)$n_cells <- rowSums(assay(sce, "tophat_counts") > 0) sce ## class: SingleCellExperiment  ## dim: 20816 379  ## metadata(2): SuppInfo which_qc ## assays(2): tophat_counts logcounts ## rownames(20816): 0610007P14Rik 0610009B22Rik ... Zzef1 Zzz3 ## rowData names(2): ave_count n_cells ## colnames(379): SRR2140028 SRR2140022 ... SRR2139341 SRR2139336 ## colData names(23): NREADS NALIGNED ... passes_qc_checks_s sizeFactor ## reducedDimNames(2): PCA TSNE ## mainExpName: endogenous ## altExpNames(1): ERCC initialPanels <- list(     ReducedDimensionPlot(         ColorBy = "Feature name", ColorByFeatureName = "Cux2", PanelWidth = 6L),     ReducedDimensionHexPlot(         ColorBy = "Feature name", ColorByFeatureName = "Cux2", PanelWidth = 6L,         BinResolution = 30) ) app <- iSEE(se = sce, initial = initialPanels)

what: Where can I find a comprehensive introduction to iSEE?
title: The iSEEhex package
text: iSEE package contains several vignettes detailing main functionality. can also take look workshop. compiled version Bioc2019 conference (based Bioconductor release 3.10) available .

title: iSEE extension for summarising data points in hexagonal bins
text: goal iSEEhex provide panels summarising data points hexagonal bins iSEE.

title: iSEE extension for summarising data points in hexagonal bins
text: Get latest stable R release CRAN. install iSEEhex Bioconductor using following code: development version GitHub :
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("iSEEhex") BiocManager::install("iSEE/iSEEhex")

title: iSEE extension for summarising data points in hexagonal bins
text: demonstration, prepare example SingleCellExperiment object. , create iSEE app compares ReducedDimensionHexPlot panel – defined package – standard ReducedDimensionPlot defined iSEE package.
code: library(scRNAseq)  # Example data ---- sce <- ReprocessedAllenData(assays="tophat_counts") class(sce) #> [1] "SingleCellExperiment" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "SingleCellExperiment"  library(scater) sce <- logNormCounts(sce, exprs_values="tophat_counts")  sce <- runPCA(sce, ncomponents=4) sce <- runTSNE(sce) rowData(sce)$ave_count <- rowMeans(assay(sce, "tophat_counts")) rowData(sce)$n_cells <- rowSums(assay(sce, "tophat_counts") > 0) sce #> class: SingleCellExperiment  #> dim: 20816 379  #> metadata(2): SuppInfo which_qc #> assays(2): tophat_counts logcounts #> rownames(20816): 0610007P14Rik 0610009B22Rik ... Zzef1 Zzz3 #> rowData names(2): ave_count n_cells #> colnames(379): SRR2140028 SRR2140022 ... SRR2139341 SRR2139336 #> colData names(23): NREADS NALIGNED ... passes_qc_checks_s sizeFactor #> reducedDimNames(2): PCA TSNE #> mainExpName: endogenous #> altExpNames(1): ERCC library(iSEEhex) #> Loading required package: iSEE initialPanels <- list(     ReducedDimensionPlot(         ColorBy = "Feature name", ColorByFeatureName = "Cux2", PanelWidth = 6L),     ReducedDimensionHexPlot(         ColorBy = "Feature name", ColorByFeatureName = "Cux2", PanelWidth = 6L,         BinResolution = 30) ) app <- iSEE(se = sce, initial = initialPanels)

title: iSEE extension for summarising data points in hexagonal bins
text: Please note iSEEhex project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: The ReducedDimensionHexPlot class — ReducedDimensionHexPlot-class
text: ReducedDimensionHexPlot ReducedDimensionPlot subclass dedicated creating reduced dimension plot summarising data points hexagonal bins.

title: The ReducedDimensionHexPlot class — ReducedDimensionHexPlot-class
text: following slots control parameters used visualization: BinResolution, numeric positive scalar specifying number hexagonal bins vertical horizontal directions. Defaults 100. addition, class inherits slots parent ReducedDimensionPlot, ColumnDotPlot, DotPlot Panel classes.

title: The ReducedDimensionHexPlot class — ReducedDimensionHexPlot-class
text: ReducedDimensionHexPlot(...) creates instance ReducedDimensionHexPlot class, slot value can passed ... named argument.

title: The ReducedDimensionHexPlot class — ReducedDimensionHexPlot-class
text: following code snippets, x instance ReducedDimensionHexPlot class. Refer documentation method details remaining arguments. defining interface: .panelColor(x) return specified default color panel class. .fullName(x) return "Hexagonal reduced dimension plot". .hideInterface(x, field) return TRUE field="Downsample" downsampling applicable panel summarizes data points hexagonal bin; otherwise function call ReducedDimensionPlot method. .defineVisualShapeInterface(x) return NULL panel, shape aesthetic applicable panel display individual data points. .defineVisualSizeInterface(x) overrides equivalent method inherited parents classes return instead HTML tag definition contains user input controlling number hexagonal bins vertical horizontal directions. .defineVisualOtherInterface(x) return NULL, additional visual parameters panel. .allowableColorByDataChoices(x, se) return character vector names continuous fields colData(se), se input SummarizedExperiment object. monitoring reactive expressions: .createObservers(x, se, input, session, pObjects, rObjects) sets observers new slots described , well parent classes via ReducedDimensionPlot method. creating plot: .generateDotPlot(x, envir) return list plot, ggplot2::ggplot() object; commands, character vector commands produce object evaluated inside envir. documentation: .definePanelTour(x) returns data.frame containing steps panel-specific tour. .getDotPlotColorHelp(x, color_choices) returns function generates rintrojs tour color choice UI.

title: The ReducedDimensionHexPlot class — ReducedDimensionHexPlot-class
text: Kevin Rue-Albrecht

title: The ReducedDimensionHexPlot class — ReducedDimensionHexPlot-class
code: library(scRNAseq)  # Example data ---- sce <- ReprocessedAllenData(assays="tophat_counts") class(sce) #> [1] "SingleCellExperiment" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "SingleCellExperiment"  library(scater) #> Loading required package: scuttle #> Loading required package: ggplot2 sce <- logNormCounts(sce, exprs_values="tophat_counts")  sce <- runPCA(sce, ncomponents=4) sce <- runTSNE(sce) rowData(sce)$ave_count <- rowMeans(assay(sce, "tophat_counts")) rowData(sce)$n_cells <- rowSums(assay(sce, "tophat_counts") > 0)  # launch the app itself ----  if (interactive()) {     iSEE(sce, initial=list(         ReducedDimensionHexPlot(BinResolution=50),         ReducedDimensionPlot()     )) }
